00051 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 //  CLASS : sc_cor

00054 //  Coroutine abstract base class.

00056 
00057 class SC_API sc_cor
00058 {
00059 protected:
00060 
00061     // constructor
00062     sc_cor() {}
00063 
00064 public:
00065 
00066     // destructor
00067     virtual ~sc_cor() {}
00068 
00069     // switch stack protection on/off
00070     virtual void stack_protect( bool /* enable */ ) {}
00071 
00072 private:
00073 
00074     // disabled
00075     sc_cor( const sc_cor& );

00080 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 //  CLASS : sc_cor_pkg
00082 //
00083 //  Coroutine package abstract base class.
00084 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 
00086 class SC_API sc_cor_pkg
00087 {
00088 public:
00089 
00090     // constructor
00091     sc_cor_pkg( sc_simcontext* simc )
00092         : m_simc( simc ) { assert( simc != 0 ); }
00093 
00094     // destructor
00095     virtual ~sc_cor_pkg() {}
00096 
00097     // create a new coroutine
00098    virtual sc_cor* create(
00099             std::size_t stack_size, sc_cor_fn* fn, void* arg ) = 0;
00100 
00101     // yield to the next coroutine
00102     virtual void yield( sc_cor* next_cor ) = 0;
00103 
00104     // abort the current coroutine (and resume the next coroutine)
00105     virtual void abort( sc_cor* next_cor ) = 0;
00106 
00107     // get the main coroutine
00108     virtual sc_cor* get_main() = 0;
00109 
00110     // get the simulation context
00111     sc_simcontext* simcontext()
00112         { return m_simc; }
00113 
00114 private:
00115 
00116     sc_simcontext* m_simc;
00117 
00118 private:
00119 
00120     // disabled
00121     sc_cor_pkg();
00122     sc_cor_pkg( const sc_cor_pkg& );
00123     sc_cor_pkg& operator = ( const sc_cor_pkg& );
00124 };
